item.title: 2D Animation
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
This is what I would consider anime. It’s poorly animated and lacks any real depth to it, just like the stuff you find on adult Swim on Saturdays.

Addressing: second animation

When a person talks, they move their jaws, tongues, and most importantly, they use their lips. Try flapping your mouth open and close like that when you speak, I doubt you’ll be able to say anything understandable.

Advice: watch something with a lot of smooth animation like Looney Tunes or Flapjack when you seek inspiration or motivation for animation. Avoid things like Bleach,Naruto Shippuden, and My Neighbor Totoro.

Advice pt. II: Buy this literature

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Animation
item.dc:creator: PharCry
item.description:
Patonki:

Only giving positive feedback is useless. What you just said had no criticism and could be summed up in one word. What you are doing is telling the creator that this level of quality is good enough. He won’t feel the need to improve, and keeps producing shit like this.

I agree. I do like having negative feedback when it’s needed. So I can see what I need to improve in.

Bolteh:

^ What the dog said.

Protip: if you wan’t to get good at animation; don’t watch anime, or at least don’t mimic it.

I don’t see the problem with anime and I wasn’t trying to >_>

EDIT: I was bored a moment ago and I made this… I watched it for about 6 minutes on loop and… I have no idea what to do now…

https://sites.google.com/site/pharcrysite/files/BlahBlahBlah.wmv?attredirects=0&d=1

It’s not flash because of my own various reasons. >_>

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Animation
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
I don’t know why these people are so discouraging. I’ve been doing animation for almost 8 years now and I really really like this. It reminds me of my own animations when I was just starting out. The fact that you already have Flash at your disposal only makes things better. I wish you the very best of luck, mate! Keep up the fantastic work and continue developing your skills!

Read full topic
